meanings.definition: The period of training for a barrister
meanings.sent1: During their pupillages, aspiring barristers learn from experienced lawyers.
meanings.sent2: She completed her pupillages at a prestigious law firm in the city.
meanings.sent3: The pupillages seemed never-ending, but the knowledge gained was invaluable.
meanings.sent4: Embarking on pupillages is like entering a legal boot camp.
meanings.sent5: The intensity of pupillages can be overwhelming but rewarding in the end.

meanings.definition: The position or status of being a pupil or student
meanings.sent1: His pupillages at the university allowed him to assist professors in research.
meanings.sent2: The pupillages of the new students were evident from their eager expressions.
meanings.sent3: She proudly displayed her pupillages badge, signifying her role as a student leader.
meanings.sent4: In the academic world, pupillages are like stepping stones to greater knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The pupillages of the young learners shone brightly in the classroom.
